verses.text: Unto \w the|strong="H0623"\w* end, for Idithun, a \w psalm|strong="H4210"\w* of \w Asaph|strong="H0623"\w*.

\w I|strong="H3045"\w* cried \w to|strong="H3478"\w* \w the|strong="H3045"\w* Lord \w with|strong="H3045"\w* \w my|strong="H3045"\w* voice; \w to|strong="H3478"\w* \w God|strong="H0430"\w* \w with|strong="H3045"\w* \w my|strong="H3045"\w* voice, \w and|strong="H3063"\w* \w he|strong="H0430"\w* gave ear \w to|strong="H3478"\w* \w me|strong="H3045"\w*.

\w In|strong="H1961"\w* \w the|strong="H1961"\w* day \w of|strong="H4585"\w* \w my|strong="H1961"\w* trouble \w I|strong="H1961"\w* sought God, \w with|strong="H1961"\w* \w my|strong="H1961"\w* hands lifted \w up|strong="H1961"\w* \w to|strong="H1961"\w* \w him|strong="H1961"\w* \w in|strong="H1961"\w* \w the|strong="H1961"\w* night, \w and|strong="H6726"\w* \w I|strong="H1961"\w* \w was|strong="H1961"\w* \w not|strong="H1961"\w* deceived. \w My|strong="H1961"\w* soul refused \w to|strong="H1961"\w* \w be|strong="H1961"\w* comforted:

\w I|strong="H8033"\w* remembered God, \w and|strong="H8033"\w* \w was|strong="H4421"\w* delighted, \w and|strong="H8033"\w* \w was|strong="H4421"\w* exercised, \w and|strong="H8033"\w* \w my|strong="H7665"\w* spirit swooned away.
\w My|strong="H0215"\w* eyes prevented \w the|strong="H0215"\w* watches: I was troubled, \w and|strong="H0859"\w* I spoke not.

\w I|strong="H3808"\w* \w thought|strong="H3820"\w* \w upon|strong="H3027"\w* \w the|strong="H3605"\w* days \w of|strong="H0376"\w* old: \w and|strong="H3027"\w* \w I|strong="H3808"\w* \w had|strong="H0376"\w* \w in|strong="H0376"\w* \w my|strong="H3605"\w* \w mind|strong="H3820"\w* \w the|strong="H3605"\w* eternal years.

\w And|strong="H0430"\w* \w I|strong="H7393"\w* meditated \w in|strong="H0430"\w* \w the|strong="H0430"\w* night \w with|strong="H0430"\w* \w my|strong="H3290"\w* own heart: \w and|strong="H0430"\w* \w I|strong="H7393"\w* \w was|strong="H0430"\w* exercised \w and|strong="H0430"\w* \w I|strong="H7393"\w* swept \w my|strong="H3290"\w* spirit.

\w Will|strong="H4310"\w* God \w then|strong="H0227"\w* cast off \w for|strong="H6440"\w* \w ever|strong="H4310"\w*? \w or|strong="H4310"\w* \w will|strong="H4310"\w* \w he|strong="H0227"\w* never \w be|strong="H3372"\w* more favourable \w again|strong="H6440"\w*?

\w Or|strong="H8085"\w* \w will|strong="H0776"\w* \w he|strong="H0776"\w* cut off \w his|strong="H8085"\w* mercy \w for|strong="H0776"\w* ever, \w from|strong="H8085"\w* generation \w to|strong="H8085"\w* generation?

\w Or|strong="H0776"\w* \w will|strong="H0430"\w* \w God|strong="H0430"\w* forget \w to|strong="H0430"\w* shew mercy? \w or|strong="H0776"\w* \w will|strong="H0430"\w* \w he|strong="H0430"\w* \w in|strong="H0430"\w* \w his|strong="H3605"\w* anger shut \w up|strong="H6965"\w* \w his|strong="H3605"\w* mercies?

\w And|strong="H0120"\w* \w I|strong="H3588"\w* said, \w Now|strong="H3588"\w* \w have|strong="H3588"\w* \w I|strong="H3588"\w* begun: \w this|strong="H3588"\w* \w is|strong="H0120"\w* \w the|strong="H3588"\w* change \w of|strong="H7611"\w* \w the|strong="H3588"\w* right hand \w of|strong="H7611"\w* \w the|strong="H3588"\w* most High.

\w I|strong="H3068"\w* remembered \w the|strong="H3605"\w* works \w of|strong="H0430"\w* \w the|strong="H3605"\w* \w Lord|strong="H3068"\w*: \w for|strong="H3605"\w* \w I|strong="H3068"\w* \w will|strong="H3068"\w* \w be|strong="H3068"\w* mindful \w of|strong="H0430"\w* thy wonders \w from|strong="H3068"\w* \w the|strong="H3605"\w* beginning.

\w And|strong="H0776"\w* \w I|strong="H0776"\w* \w will|strong="H0776"\w* meditate \w on|strong="H0776"\w* all thy works: \w and|strong="H0776"\w* \w will|strong="H0776"\w* \w be|strong="H0776"\w* employed \w in|strong="H0776"\w* thy inventions.
Thy way, O God, is in the holy place: who is the great God like our God?
Thou art the God that dost wonders. Thou hast made thy power known among the nations:
With thy arm thou hast redeemed thy people the children of Jacob and of Joseph.
The waters saw thee, O God, the waters saw thee: and they were afraid, and the depths were troubled.
Great was the noise of the waters: the clouds sent out a sound. For thy arrows pass:
The voice of thy thunder in a wheel. Thy lightnings enlightened the world: the earth shook and trembled.
Thy way is in the sea, and thy paths in many waters: and thy footsteps shall not be known.
Thou hast conducted thy people like sheep, by the hand of Moses and Aaron.
